pageTitle: Japanese Comic Ranking, April 4-10 - News - Anime News Network
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {43029=As of April 10, Moshi Kōkō Yakyū no Joshi Manager ga Drucker no "Management" o Yondara, Natsumi Iwasaki's novel that inspired the upcoming Moshidora television anime series and live-action film, sold 2,020,434 copies. In February, the novel supplanted J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows as the best-selling "general" book since Oricon began reporting book sales in Japan in 2008. (Oricon reports comic/manga and bunko sales in separate categories from the "general" book category; there are comic/manga and bunko books that have sold more copies than Moshidora.)}
textBeforeTable: As of April 10, Moshi Kōkō Yakyū no Joshi Manager ga Drucker no "Management" o Yondara, Natsumi Iwasaki's novel that inspired the upcoming Moshidora television anime series and live-action film, sold 2,020,434 copies. In February, the novel supplanted J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows as the best-selling "general" book since Oricon began reporting book sales in Japan in 2008. (Oricon reports comic/manga and bunko sales in separate categories from the "general" book category; there are comic/manga and bunko books that have sold more copies than Moshidora.)
